item.title: It's All Happening
item.description:
**Getting to BADcamp/Parking**
There is no Cal Football game this year, so parking should be MUCH
easier than last year. By all means, take BART if you can - it's closer
than almost anywhere you can park and cheaper. See the map here:
http://2011.badcamp.net/logistics/directions. But if you are bringing
your car to BADcamp, grab a buddy and check out our handy map here:
http://2011.badcamp.net/logistics

**Registration - Saturday & Sunday, 8:30am-9:30am**
Registration, as well as many of our sessions, will be in Dwinelle Plaza
on the Berkeley Campus. Yes, we have a map for that:
http://2011.badcamp.net/logistics
Join us at 8:30 for coffee, vegan donuts, & bagels, and get your BADcamp
badge, schedule, and wi-fi access code.

**Parties**
The rumors are true, BADcamp does like to party. If you're only coming
to the camp, you're missing half the fun.

*Saturday - An Evening of Drupal at Zellerbach Auditorium - 6pm*
This is going to be a night to remember. We sincerely hope you'll join
us in the beautiful Zellerbach Auditorium to mingle, enjoy the musical
stylings of DJ Batson and DJ Spinnerty, partake in FREE tacos,
flatbreads, nachos, and flautas for dinner, and have a drink or two on
BADcamp before the main program.

We have three fantastic speakers from Drupal and beyond:
* Dries Buytaert, Creator of Drupal
* Jeff Robbins, Founder, Lullabot
* Danese Cooper, Open Source Strategist for the Bill & Melinda Gates
Foundation.

Afterwards, we'll keep the party going at Zellerbach with DJs and Drinks
until 11:30pm before heading over to the Bear's Lair Pub on campus until
2am. All evening events are just a short stroll from the BADcamp basecamp.

Get the map and full program details here:
http://2011.badcamp.net/program/sessions/evening-drupal-dine-drink-and-d...

**Coder Lounge - Hotel Shattuck, 6th Floor**
The CHX Coder Lounge will be open from Friday at noon and through the
weekend. Coffee service will begin at 3:45pm and will be available 24
hours, as will the room itself. So when inspiration strikes at 3am,
we've got you covered (and caffeinated).

The Coder Lounge will not be doing any registration so please pick up
your badge at one of the trainings, summits, pre-registration, or at
registration on Sat/Sun.

**Birds of a Feather - Signups Open Online**
BOF Room Signup is Open! http://2011.badcamp.net/program/bofs We'll have
the traditional sign-up board at the event, but if you want to reserve a
room now, you can do so on the site.

Okay, got all that? Great. Get some sleep, pack a hoodie (it's NorCal)
and your love of all things Drupally, and get ready to spend your
weekend with BADcamp. All 1450 of you.

- Team BADcamp

item.title: System Administrator
item.description:
Company: 
Promet Source

PrometSource.com - a Chicago based web and mobile application development company - is looking to hire a System Administrator. We build some of the more innovative Drupal websites and have great clients that are leaders in their communities and have extensive reach in the broad audience. We are looking to add an experienced System Administrator who wants to be a part of a fun, collaborative team of individuals where every one's voice is heard and all ideas are always considered.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:

The System Administrator is responsible for effective provisioning, installation/configuration, operation, and maintenance of systems hardware and software and related infrastructure. This individual participates in technical research and development to enable continuing innovation within the infrastructure. This individual ensures that system hardware, operating systems, software systems, and related procedures adhere to organizational values.

This individual will assist project teams with technical issues in the Initiation and Planning phases of our projects. These activities include the definition of needs, benefits, and technical strategy; research & development within the project life-cycle; technical analysis and design; and support of operations staff in executing, testing and rolling-out the solutions. Participation on projects is focused on smoothing the transition of projects from development to production by performing operations activities within the project life-cycle.

System Administrator Engineering and Provisioning

1. Engineering of SA-related solutions for various project and operational needs.

2. Install new / rebuild existing servers and configure hardware, peripherals, services, settings, directories, storage, etc. in accordance with standards and project/operational requirements.

3. Install and configure systems such as supports infrastructure applications.

4. Develop and maintain installation and configuration procedures.

5. Contribute to and maintain system standards.

6. Research and recommend innovative, and where possible automated, approaches for system administration tasks. Identify approaches that leverage our resources and provide economies of scale.

Operations and Support

7. Perform daily system monitoring, verifying the integrity and availability of all hardware, server resources, systems and key processes, reviewing system and application logs, and verifying completion of scheduled jobs such as backups.

8. Perform regular security monitoring to identify any possible intrusions.

9. Perform daily backup operations, ensuring all required file systems and system data are successfully backed up to the appropriate media, recovery tapes or disks are created, and media is recycled and sent off site as necessary.

10. Perform regular file archival and purge as necessary.

11. Create, change, and delete user accounts per request.

12. Provide other support per request from various staff members. Investigate and troubleshoot issues.

13. Repair and recover from hardware or software failures. Coordinate and communicate with impacted parties.

Maintenance

14. Apply OS patches and upgrades on a regular basis, and upgrade administrative tools and utilities. Configure / add new services as necessary.

15. Upgrade and configure system software that supports infrastructure applications per project or operational needs.

16. Maintain operational, configuration, or other procedures.

17. Perform periodic performance reporting to support capacity planning.

18. Perform ongoing performance tuning, hardware upgrades, and resource optimization as required. Configure CPU, memory, and disk partitions as required.

19. Maintain data center environmental and monitoring equipment.

KNOWLEDGE/SKILLS:

1. Bachelor (4-year) degree, with a technical major, such as engineering or computer science.

2. Two to four year’s system administration experience.

Competitive pay and ability to work on fantastic clients in a laid back fun environment. The experience of working directly with friendly and supportive clients. Some of our past and current clients include sba.gov, sprint.com, large associations with major offices in DC area (can't mention them by name), startups, small business and lots of creative companies.

Of course we offer competitive compensation, full health care plan and profit sharing.

Promet Source is an Open Source Web and Mobile web application development company. Promet has been building open source websites since 2003. We are a very entrepreneurial company which seeks to continually redevelop its skill set. We are a flat organization which means everyone has a say and we encourage everyone to develop their interest. We love to work on social aspects of the web and mobile apps.

Please email resumes to jobs2@promethost.com

To support these efforts, the Director will lead the development of market positioning, messaging, web content, and collateral for multiple Acquia products, as well as work closely with product owners to determine market requirements and strategy.

We are seeking an experienced product marketing professional to join our Marketing team to support our Cloud hosting and applications products.

Responsibilities

Development of messaging and positioning for Acquia products, working closely with R&D to translate product capabilities into features and benefits for customers.
Work closely with Product Owner to perform market research to evaluate potential requirements and shape future product direction.
Create and deliver customer-facing presentations, including in-person speaking engagements and live webinars.
Engage with industry analysts to educate them on Acquia products and research market trends to drive product direction.
Develop go-to-market programs in conjunction with Marketing Programs team to generate leads and meet quarterly objectives. Create all web content, product videos, product collateral and sales training materials required in execution of GTM programs.
Plan, develop and deliver product webinars. Responsibilities include planning and scheduling of webinars to match quarterly marketing objectives, writing webinar abstracts, creating and delivering webinar presentations.
Work closely with content and public relations team to develop and execute content strategies to generate media / blogger interest in Acquia products. Act as spokesperson for products and generate byline content for media distribution.
Develop case studies and customer briefs – working with sales and customers to coordinate customer case studies.
Train the Acquia sales team on product capabilities, positioning in the market versus competitors and effective selling strategies.
